triples.name: Weighted model counting
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a novel deterministic search-based approach for weighted model counting, extending beyond existing sampling-based methods.

triples.name: Bayesian network
triples.relevance: Bayesian networks are used as a key application domain for testing the proposed weighted model counting approach.

triples.name: Probabilistic logic
triples.relevance: Probabilistic reasoning is the foundational concept that weighted model counting serves to enable.

triples.name: Sampling (statistics)
triples.relevance: The paper contrasts its deterministic approach with existing sampling-based approximate techniques that provide statistical convergence guarantees.

triples.name: Graphical model
triples.relevance: Probabilistic graphs are used as test application domain for reliability estimation tasks in the proposed approach.

triples.name: Marginal distribution
triples.relevance: Computing marginal probabilities in Bayesian networks is one of the primary application tasks for the proposed WMC approach.

triples.name: Heuristic (computer science)
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a novel value heuristic that guides search exploration toward high-weight models.

triples.name: Beam search
triples.relevance: Limited Discrepancy Search, which is a related technique to beam search, is used in the proposed approach to accelerate bound convergence.

triples.name: Approximation algorithm
triples.relevance: The paper provides approximation guarantees with hard lower and upper bounds on the true weighted model counting value.

triples.name: Reliability engineering
triples.relevance: Reliability estimation in probabilistic graphs is one of the benchmark application domains evaluated in the paper.
